metadata.key_specifications: 3-input NOR gate, 3.3V/5V operation, Schmitt-trigger inputs, low power consumption

page_summaries.content:
The 74LVC1G27 provides one 3-input NOR function.
Inputs can be driven from either 3.3 V or 5 V devices. This feature allows the use of these devices as translators in mixed 3.3 V and 5 V applications.
Schmitt-trigger action at all inputs makes the circuit tolerant of slower input rise and fall time.

CL = Load capacitance including jig and probe capacitance;

Product Summary.content: The 74LVC1G27 provides one 3-input NOR function. Inputs can be driven from either 3.3 V or 5 V devices, allowing the use of these devices as translators in mixed 3.3 V and 5 V applications.

The 74LVC1G27 features Schmitt-trigger action at all inputs, making the circuit tolerant of slower input rise and fall time. This provides an overview of the key features and general description of the product.

The text covers various aspects of the 74LVC1G27 product, including its general description, features and benefits, ordering information, marking, functional diagram, pinning information, functional description, limiting values, recommended operating conditions, static and dynamic characteristics, waveforms and test circuit, and package outline.

Electrical Characteristics.content: 8. Limiting values: Table 5 provides the limiting values for the electronic component in accordance with the Absolute Maximum Rating System (IEC 60134). Voltages are referenced to GND (ground = 0 V).
9. Recommended operating conditions: Table 6 specifies the recommended operating conditions for the electronic component.
10. Static characteristics: Table 7 lists the static characteristics of the electronic component at recommended operating conditions. Voltages are referenced to GND (ground = 0 V).

11. Dynamic characteristics: Table 8 provides the dynamic characteristics of the electronic component. Voltages are referenced to GND (ground = 0 V), and the test circuit is shown in Fig. 8. 11.1 Waveforms and test circuit: The test data for measuring switching times (tPLH, tPHL) is given in Table 10, including supply voltage, input signal, load capacitance, load resistance, and external voltage conditions.

Test circuit definitions: RL = Load resistance, CL = Load capacitance including jig and probe capacitance, RT = Termination resistance (equal to output impedance of pulse generator), VEXT = External voltage for measuring switching times.

Reliability and Environmental Conditions.content: 8. Limiting values: Table 5 provides the limiting values or absolute maximum ratings for the component, in accordance with the Absolute Maximum Rating System (IEC 60134). These values define the maximum permissible operating conditions for parameters such as voltages, currents, and temperatures, beyond which the component may suffer permanent damage or degradation.

9. Recommended operating conditions: Table 6 specifies the recommended operating conditions for the component, which are typically more conservative than the limiting values. These conditions ensure reliable and optimal performance of the component within its specified operating range.

Environmental conditions and reliability tests: This section typically covers information about the environmental conditions under which the component is designed to operate, such as temperature ranges, humidity levels, and mechanical stresses. It may also include details about the reliability tests performed on the component, such as accelerated life testing, temperature cycling, and environmental stress screening.

Operating temperature range: This chunk focuses specifically on the specified temperature range within which the component is designed to operate reliably. It may include details about the ambient temperature range, as well as the maximum and minimum junction or case temperatures allowed during operation.
